english: I feel like dating a smaller guy doesn't make me feel protected, but rather like I'm going on a trip with a middle schooler. But most people don't really care about height anymore, do they?

english: I feel like dating a smaller guy doesn't make me feel protected, but rather like I'm going on a trip with a middle schooler. But most people don't really care about height anymore, do they?

english: Even after the legal age of adulthood got lowered to 18, it seems like there's still a lot of places where they continue to do their coming of age ceremonies at 20, as they'd been doing before.

english: "I had to keep company to the toilet all last night after getting stomach ache from the oysters I ate." "Are you okay? Do you need to take today off?" "Yeah, I will." "Alright. I'll let everyone know so make sure you get some good rest." "Thank you."

english: "Mum, I'm going out." "Where to?" "University?" "Isn't it spring break now? What are you going there for?" "A club?" "Looking that smart?" "It's all right isn't it? It shouldn't matter where I go." "Fine, but you've got bed hair at the back." "Seriously?"

english: Since futons are bulky, it's a good idea to compress and store futons that are used infrequently, such as guest futons, in a vacuum-sealed storage bag.

english: "Hey, did you know? Mr. Tanaka is getting married!" "Really?? When?" "I think the wedding is next week."

english: "Why wasn’t my writing chosen?" "Toru, while your writing is certainly beautiful — you have the basics down and are well-organized overall — the feelings still just aren't there." "'Feelings'?" "Yes. If you don't put your personal feelings into your brushwork, it's rather lifeless. Think about how to do it in your own way. I'll be looking forward to seeing your next attempt."

japanese: 試してみたことないよ。
english: I've never tried it before.

japanese: 電話番号交換しようよ。
english: Let's exchange phone numbers.

japanese: 違う学校に行っても、たまには僕のこと思い出してね。
english: Even if you go to another school, think about me from time to time, OK?

japanese: 試験、絶対に合格しろよ。
english: You shall surely pass the test.

japanese: 絶対誰にも言わないから、好きな人の名前を教えて。
english: I promise I won't tell anybody, so tell me who you like.

japanese: 今の話、誰にも言わないって約束して。お願い。
english: Promise me you won't tell anyone about what we just talked about. Please.

japanese: トム、ちょっと顔貸せよ。
english: Tom, come with me.

japanese: 十年間、この部屋に誰も居なかった。
english: The room has been empty for ten years.

japanese: 4番ホームはどこですか？
english: Where can I find platform number four?

japanese: 「何時に起きてる？」「8時」
english: "What time do you get up?" "Eight."

japanese: 試着室はどこかしら？
english: Where's the dressing room?

japanese: 最近ノート取り方を変えて、それから数学に自信がついてきた。例えば、テストの時これまでは、何もわからないから、成績が悪かった。でも、昨日テストをしたら、結果はまだわからないけど、やっと上手くいったと思うよ。
english: I recently changed the way I take notes, and ever since then I've gained confidence in math. For example, usually when I take tests, I don't know anything, and I get bad grades. But yesterday I took a test, and although I don't know my score yet, I think it went well for once.

japanese: 体にいいものが食べたいな。
english: I want to eat something wholesome.

japanese: 僕には、食べすぎる癖があるんで、ちょっと肥満なんだ。それで、体重を減らすために、同じ経験のあるパパが僕にダイエットを始めさせたんだ。このダイエットでは、パパも僕も朝ご飯を食べない。最初はやっぱり難しかったけどでも頑張ったら慣れて、ちゃんとできる。
english: I have a tendency to overeat, so I'm somewhat overweight. So, to get me to lose weight, my dad, who's experienced with this, started me on a diet. In this diet, neither my dad nor I will eat breakfast. It's been hard at first, but if I keep going, I'll get used to it and then I'll be able to do it just fine.

japanese: 何泊するの？
english: How many nights will you be staying?

japanese: 何泊のご予定ですか？
english: How many nights will you be staying?

japanese: いくら食べても太らない人、羨ましいなぁ。
english: I'm jealous of people that can eat as much as they want and not get fat.

japanese: パパ以外の僕の家族は、みんなこっちにいる。だから、この町に住んでいたい。
english: I want to live in this town because, except for my dad, all my family is here.

japanese: 「この酒、マズいけどね！」「さぁ、飲み続けて。だんだんうまくなるから」
english: "This stuff tastes gross!" "Keep drinking. It'll taste better the more you drink it."

english: "I wonder whether I'll ever get better." "Don't say that, Yumi. You'll get better. I know you will. So pull yourself together."

english: "You're still eating breakfast at this time of day?" "I slept in this morning and I just got up."

english: The teacher arrived.

japanese: 「先生、正直に答えてください。由美はとても悪い状態なんですね？」「ま、そう言っていいと思う」
english: "Doctor, please answer me honestly. Yumi's in very bad shape, isn't she?" "Well, I guess you could say that."

english: "You look really tired." "I'm not tired."

english: I'm sorry, I can't do that now.

japanese: すみませんが、今はできません。

japanese: ごめん、今手が離せないよ。

japanese: ごめんなさい。今他のことしてます。

japanese: 今日は由美の誕生日よ。由美にとって最高の一日になるように、皆で一緒に頑張ろう！
english: Today's Yumi's birthday. Let's work together to make this a special day for her!

japanese: 私、お父さまがいらっしゃらなくても、毎日お父さまのこと考えてたわ。
english: Even while you weren't here, Papa, I thought about you every day.

japanese: 「お願いがあるんです」「いいよ。言ってごらん」
english: "I need to ask you a favor." "Sure. What is it?"

japanese: 「トムは食べる前にいつも水飲むんだけど、なんでだろう？」「時々私も飲むわよ。食べる量を減らしやすくなるからね」
english: "I don't understand why Tom always drinks water before eating something." "I do that too sometimes. It helps me eat less."

japanese: 「パパ、お帰りなさい」「ただいま、萌々香。お土産だよ」「パパ、ありがとう。私ね、パパがいない間も、ずっとパパのこと考えてたのよ」「それは、嬉しいな。ありがとう。パパのどんなことを考えてくれてたの？」「えっとね・・・ パパ、どんなお人形さん買ってきてくれるかなぁとか、萌々香の好きなお菓子いっぱい買ってきてくれるかなぁとか・・・お洋服も。わぁ、このクマちゃんのぬいぐるみかわいい。こんなの欲しかったんだ。パパ、大好き」
english: "Daddy, welcome back!" "Hey, Momoka! I brought you something." "Thanks, Daddy. I was thinking of you all the time when you weren't here." "That's sweet. Thank you. What things were you thinking about daddy?" "Well, I was thinking of what kind of doll you'd buy me, whether you'd bring me lots of my favorite candy...and clothes. Whoa, this bear plushie is so cute! It's just the one I wanted. I love you, Daddy."

japanese: 皆さん、ちょっと休憩しましょう。クッキーが届きましたよ。
english: Everyone, let's take a small break. The cookies have arrived.

japanese: わぁ、カバンの中でバナナが潰れてるよ。
english: Aw man! My banana got squished in my bag.

japanese: このバナナケースを使うと、バナナを潰すことなく持ち運べます。
english: By using this banana case, you can transport bananas without squashing them.

japanese: あの人、厚かましいったらありゃしない。

english: I answered in one word.

english: Every parent probably has that moment where they want to just stop being one, no matter how much they love their kid.

english: "Are there a lot of houses with basements in the U.S.?" "Not really. I mean, it depends on the region."

japanese: 「電動自転車に乗ってる奴ってずるいよな」「どうしたの？」「だって、こっちは一生懸命汗水たらして漕いでるのに、涼しい顔して勝ち誇ったように横を追い抜いてくんだよ。めっちゃ悔しい」
english: "Those guys on electric bikes, it's not fair." "What's the matter?" "It's just, here I am pedaling hard, dripping with sweat, and they come along passing me all calm and triumphant like. It's so infuriating!"

japanese: 「やっと着いた」「おかえり。すごい汗ね」「うん。電動自転車に乗ってる奴に追い越されそうになったから、ちょっと頑張ってみた」「で、どうだったの？」「負けた」
english: "Phew, I made it." "Welcome back. You're sweating like crazy." "Yeah. A guy on an electric bike was about to pass me, so I really gave it my all." "And? How'd that go?" "I lost."

japanese: 「おかえり。遅かったわね」「うん。いつも電動自転車で抜いてく奴がバッテリーが切れて自転車押してたから手伝ってた。電動自転車って、めっちゃ重いんだよ。びっくりした」「ふぅん。ところで、その子って、女の子？男の子？」「えっ」「何でもない。そうやって恋が芽生えるのかなって思って」
english: "Welcome back. You're later than usual." "Yeah. The person who's always passing me on their electric bike had their battery die and was pushing it, so I was helping them. Electric bikes are super heavy; it surprised me." "Hmm. By the way, this kid, is it a girl or boy?" "Huh?" "Never mind. I was just thinking, 'That's how love begins, isn't it?'"

japanese: 私たちは子どもを背負ってました。
english: We carried our children on our backs.

japanese: 子供たちをおんぶしてました。
english: We carried our children on our backs.

japanese: 私たちは子供たちを負ぶったのよ。
english: We carried our children on our backs.

english: Babies start crying in the evening, so I was always carrying him on my back while making dinner.

english: "How many people have you gone out on a date with up to now?" "Why the question all of a sudden?" "I was just curious."

english: "Is there a post office around here?" "Yes, just take a right at that intersection up there."

japanese: 棕櫚ほうきは日本の伝統的なほうきで、耐久性に優れ丈夫で長持ちします。

japanese: 「ただいま、持ち帰り買ってきた」「なになに？」「とんこつラーメンよ」「うわー、僕のことよくわかってるね！いただきまーす」
english: "I'm back! I brought some takeout." "What'd you get?" "Some tonkotsu ramen." "Whoa, you know me so well! Well, let's eat already!"

japanese: うちの子、咳とくしゃみが続いてて。

english: "I found Mom's secret stash!" "Where was it?" "In the closet, on the second floor." "That’s not Mom's. She wouldn't hide it there." "So is it Dad's?" "Not really, I think Dad just forgot it there while drunk. How much is there?" "20,000 yen." "So, what do you want to eat?"

japanese: サッカーは世界で一番のスポーツだ！
english: Soccer is the best sport of the world!

japanese: 幸いにも、ドライブスルーは24時間365日開いていた。
english: Thankfully, the drive-thru was open 24/7.

japanese: ありがたいことに、ドライブスルーは年中無休だった。
english: Thankfully, the drive-thru was open 24/7.

japanese: 紙飛行機の作り方、知ってる？
english: Do you know how to make paper airplanes?

japanese: 紙飛行機の折り方、分かる？
english: Do you know how to make paper airplanes?

japanese: 訳が間違っています。
english: The translation is wrong.

japanese: 親に、それをするにはまだ若すぎるって言われちゃった。
english: My parents said that I was too young to do that.

japanese: 私が勝手に気を揉んでるだけなんだけどね。
english: Don't mind me, I'm just worrying myself over nothing.

japanese: いつもくだらないことで気を揉んでるよね？
english: You're always troubling yourself over trivial things, aren't you?

japanese: 父さんは、僕が３歳の時、家を出て行ったよ。
english: My father left home when I was three.

japanese: あの部屋には近寄るんじゃないぞ。
english: Don't go anywhere near that room.

japanese: トムは今、息を引き取りました。
english: Tom just took his last breath.

japanese: 僕とデートしてください。
english: Please date me.

japanese: 毎日、誰かの誕生日だよ。
english: Every day is someone's birthday.

japanese: 365日いつだって、誰かの誕生日なんだ。
english: Every day is someone's birthday.

japanese: 水が凍って、氷になった。
english: The water froze and turned to ice.

japanese: 骨が折れてます。
english: The bone is broken.

japanese: 冷蔵庫が壊れた。
english: Our fridge broke.

japanese: 何日も寝てないんです。
english: I haven't slept for several days.

japanese: 警察に電話したのは、お前か？
english: Are you the one who called the police?

japanese: 警察に通報したのって、あなたなの？
english: Are you the one who called the police?

japanese: 温かい水が欲しい。
english: I need warm water.

japanese: 魚、美味しい？
english: Is the fish tasty?

japanese: 魚も動物ですか？
english: Are fish also animals?

japanese: トビウオがいるよ。
english: There are flying fish.

japanese: 魚どう？美味しい？
english: How's the fish? Is it good?

japanese: 突然、電話が鳴った。
english: Suddenly the phone rang.

japanese: 私は農奴です。
english: I am a serf.

japanese: 私が話してるときは立ちなさい。
english: Stand up when I'm talking to you.

japanese: 狐の嫁入りだ。
english: It's sunny here, but it's raining.

japanese: スーツケース盗まれたみたい。
english: I think somebody stole my suitcase.

japanese: 風の音がする。
english: I hear the wind blow.

japanese: 傘、貸してもらっていい？
english: Can you lend me your umbrella?

japanese: 大きくなったら、僕も先生になろっと。
english: When I grow up I will be a teacher, too.

japanese: 生まれてこなきゃよかったな。
english: I wish I was never born.

japanese: やっと、動いた。
english: Finally it moved.

japanese: まだ勝てるチャンスはあるって。
english: You still have a chance to win.

japanese: 食べ物で遊ばない。
english: Don't play with the food.

japanese: もう少しだけ、いてもいいですか？
english: Can we stay just a bit longer?

japanese: トム、パンをくれ。
english: Tom, give me the bread.

japanese: トム、パンちょうだい。
english: Tom, give me the bread.

japanese: 料理もするの？
english: You cook too?

japanese: ご飯を作ったりもするの？
english: You cook too?

japanese: どんなパンが好き？
english: What kind of bread do you like?

japanese: この引用文はどこから引っ張ってきたの？
english: Where does this quote come from?

japanese: この引用はどこから持ってきたの？
english: Where does this quote come from?

japanese: この引用文はどこで見つけたの？
english: Where did you find this quote?

japanese: この引用はどこにあったの？
english: Where did you find this quote?

japanese: このお皿、汚れてます。
english: This plate is dirty.

japanese: この皿、汚ね。
english: This plate is dirty.

japanese: 「この蜂蜜って、ウクライナ産なんだって」「へぇ。何の花の蜜なの？」「『ひまわり』と『菜の花』の百花蜜なんだって。ここに書いてあるよ。ほらっ」「ホントだ。これ買ってみよう」
english: "Apparently, this honey is produced in Ukraine." "Huh. What flower is it made with?" "It's a multi-flower honey, made with sunflower and rapeseed. Look, it's written right here." "Oh, it is. Let's try buying this."

japanese: 息子は５歳です。
english: My son is five years old.

japanese: パソコン使っていいですか？
english: Can I use the computer?

japanese: 今回ご紹介するのは、低カロリーで滑らかな口当たりの豆腐でできたケーキです。ぜひご賞味ください。
english: Now, I present a low-calorie, velvety tofu cake. Please enjoy.

japanese: 即決でした。
english: It was a quick decision.

japanese: もうすぐお母さんになるのね。
english: You're going to be a mom soon.

japanese: チケット購入の際には、列にお並びください。
english: You have to get in line to buy a ticket.

japanese: 窓開けたの、誰？
english: Who opened the window?

japanese: 運転手がドアを開けた。
english: The driver opened the door.

japanese: これは車庫の鍵よ。
english: This is the key to the garage.

japanese: これが、ガレージの鍵です。
english: This is the key to the garage.

japanese: ちょっと練習しなきゃ。
english: I need a little practice.

japanese: あなたの説明の方が信憑性があるね。
english: Your explanation is more convincing.

japanese: このシャツ、ネクタイに合ってない。
english: This shirt doesn't match the tie.

japanese: 下にスクロールして。
english: Scroll down.

japanese: スペースキーが、キーボードの中で一番大きいキーです。
english: The spacebar is the largest key on your keyboard.

japanese: お荷物は明日お送りします。
english: Your package will be sent tomorrow.

japanese: テーブルの上に手紙が山積みになっている。
english: There is a stack of letters on the table.

japanese: テーブルに、手紙が積み重ねてある。
english: There is a stack of letters on the table.

japanese: 海には魚がたくさんいます。
english: There are many fish in the sea.
